pullRequest.body:
From "Formalizing the Bruhat-Tits tree"
Co-authored-by: Judith Ludwig <ludwig@mathi.uni-heidelberg.de>

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [f6d8cf95e5](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/21141/commits/f6d8cf95e5c922e8f2af04866c7d78c331e0cf62)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ Pi.mulSingle_induction`
`+ Pi.single_induction`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.

bors merge

Thanks!

Strictly speaking, this doesn't need commutativity, right? So I would imagine the proofs could be generalized using `Finset.noncommProd`, but that's a task for another PR...

> Co-authored-by: Judith Ludwig

As a general note, you need to put an email address here as `Judith LudWig <judith@somewhere.com>` for `git` / Github to attribute the co-authorship.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12999795640/job/36255850494)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12999795640/job/36255850311)

Thanks!

maintainer delegate
You can add `variable [Finite Î¹] [DecidableEq Î¹] {M : Type*}` before the lemmas to save some variables. At least `Î¹` is already introduced in the file so no need to reintroduce it.

```suggestion
-- manually additivized to fix variable names
-- See https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/issues/11462
```

Wait, why do you need this?
```suggestion
```
Because of `to_additive existing` and `elab_as_elim`.
Doesn't `to_additive (attr := elab_as_elim)` work?
I don't know how to tell whether the attribute is applied. I just copied the `set_option linter.existingAttributeWarning false in; @[<attr>, to_additive existing]` pattern from somewhere else.

> I don't know how to tell whether the attribute is applied

Trust and a votive candle

> I just copied the `set_option linter.existingAttributeWarning false in; @[<attr>, to_additive existing]` pattern from somewhere else.

That's an anti-pattern :^)

> > I don't know how to tell whether the attribute is applied
> 
> Trust and a votive candle

I don't know how that answers my question.
The linter says to put `@[to_additive (attr := elab_as_elim) existing]` on the mul version and nothing on the additive one if I understand correctly.

Yes, I am just suspicious if this interacts correctly with `existing` given that in this case there are many place where the linter is silenced instead. Changed it anyway now, would still be interested in how to find out whether the attribute is applied though.

I did a test for the `simp` attribute in `Algebra.Symmetrized` and it seems to work fine. I think most of the disabled linters are for attributes which are put after the declaration, as in that case the suggestion cannot be applied.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Algebra): `Pi.single_induction`
